question.title: Setting dispatcher:FORWARD makes struts.actionMapping to noActionMapping in Struts 2
question.body:
To get the struts.actionMapping in JSP or tags we use struts.actionMapping of request as an example this:

 <s:property value="#request['struts.actionMapping']"/>

Shows some thing like:

ActionMapping{name='own-to-other-form', namespace='/transaction/fundtransfer',
              method='form', extension='ib', params={}, result=null}

Actually we use

<s:property value="#request['struts.actionMapping'].name"/>

to get action name.

When I change the StrutsPrepareAndExecuteFilter to use

<dispatcher>REQUEST</dispatcher> 
<dispatcher>FORWARD</dispatcher>

The above tag shows noActionMapping.

Is there any way I can fix it?

answers.body:
I encountered the noActionMapping result recently in the JSPs after updating from Struts 2 to a newer Struts 6 version. #request['struts.actionMapping'] wasn't returning the action mapping anymore.

Since the action name is also accessible via the ActionContext, a workaround that worked for me was to use:

<s:property value="%{org.apache.struts2.ActionContext.name}"/>

Alternatively, a method could be added to the Action class so the JSPs can access it, but this may not be as clean, e.g.:

public String getActionName() {
    return ActionContext.getContext().getActionName();
}
